title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Education

Doctor of Philosophy ‚Äì Bioinformatics and Genomics Aug 2025 ‚Äì Present The Pennsylvania State University, State College, PA


Master of Science ‚Äì Bioinformatics Aug 2023 ‚Äì May 2025 Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA


Bachelor of Technology ‚Äì Biotechnology Aug 2019 ‚Äì May 2023 PES University, India

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Experience

Graduate Research Assistant Jan 2024 ‚Äì Dec 2024 Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA


Developed a computational pipeline to investigate the influence of ancestry and environment on polygenic scores across five diseases in a diverse WGS cohort of ~10,000 individuals
Integrated DNA methylation data to explore the impact of weathering on disease risk profiles




Summer Intern Jun 2024 ‚Äì Aug 2024 M.D.¬†Anderson Cancer Center, Houston, TX


Implemented machine learning models with over 35,000 features to predict tumor-specific total mRNA expression (TmS) across two lung cancer types
Performed survival analysis on TCGA datasets to examine time-to-event data, identifying significant factors influencing patient outcomes
Conducted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) with over 30,000 genes to validate results and identify significantly over-expressed genes and pathways




Project Intern Jan 2023 ‚Äì Jun 2023 Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru, India


Spearheaded rare variant-specific genome-wide association studies (GWAS) utilizing WGS data in a cohort of over 2,000 individuals
Developed and optimized a parallelized computational pipeline to detect disease associations with rare variants and identify causal variants
Built an automated pipeline for quality control and downstream genomic data analyses




Research Intern Jun 2022 ‚Äì Dec 2022 Leucine Rich Bio Pvt Ltd, Bengaluru, India


Curated and managed a comprehensive database highlighting key insights on the gut microbiome and its association with Parkinson‚Äôs disease
Explored gut microbiome implications through bioinformatics data analysis on Galaxy

title: Curriculum Vitae
text:
Projects

Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease Classifier from fMRI Data | GitHub
Leveraged machine learning approaches to classify Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease patients, Mild Cognitive Impairment patients, and Healthy Controls using 60 fMRI scans from the ADNI database, achieving 78% prediction accuracy.
CityScout ‚Äì Identifying Safe Cities Based on Crime Statistics | GitHub
Built a web-based tool to identify safe U.S. cities using customizable filters by analyzing 2 TB of FBI crime data via PySpark on Google Cloud Platform with Tableau visualization.
Comparison of ML Models to Predict Absorption Properties | GitHub
Applied and compared four ML models to predict PPBR, bioavailability, and PAMPA for drug discovery applications, achieving 71% model accuracy using PyTDC data.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text: Welcome to my first blog post! In this article, I‚Äôll walk you through how I built this website using Quarto, a modern publishing system that‚Äôs particularly well-suited for academic and technical content.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text: Welcome to my first blog post! In this article, I‚Äôll walk you through how I built this website using Quarto, a modern publishing system that‚Äôs particularly well-suited for academic and technical content.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Why Quarto?
As a bioinformatics PhD student, I needed a platform that could:

Handle Technical Content: Support for code blocks, mathematical equations, and scientific notation
Be Easy to Maintain: Simple markdown-based content creation
Look Professional: Clean, responsive design without extensive CSS work
Support Blogging: Easy way to share research insights and tutorials
Integrate with GitHub: Seamless version control and deployment

Quarto checked all these boxes and more. It‚Äôs built by Posit (formerly RStudio) and is designed specifically for creating scientific and technical documents.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Website Structure
This website has a simple but effective structure:

Home Page (CV)
The landing page features my curriculum vitae, showcasing my education, experience, projects, and publications. Using Quarto‚Äôs about page template with the ‚Äújolla‚Äù style gives it a clean, professional look with social media links prominently displayed.


Blog Section
A dedicated blog area where I can share: - Research insights and findings - Tutorials on bioinformatics tools and techniques - Career reflections and advice - Conference experiences
Each blog post lives in its own directory under posts/, which makes it easy to organize post-specific assets like images and data files.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Technology Stack
Here‚Äôs what powers this website:

Quarto: The static site generator that converts markdown files into HTML
GitHub: Version control for tracking all changes
GitHub Actions: Automated CI/CD pipeline that builds and deploys the site
GitHub Pages: Free hosting for the published website

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Automated Deployment with GitHub Actions
One of the best features of this setup is the automated deployment pipeline. Every time I push changes to the main branch:

GitHub Actions triggers automatically
The workflow sets up Quarto in a clean environment
Quarto renders all .qmd files into HTML
The generated _site/ directory is deployed to GitHub Pages
The website updates within minutes

This means I can focus on writing content without worrying about the build and deployment process.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
The Build Process
Here‚Äôs what happens when Quarto builds the site:
quarto render
This single command: - Processes all .qmd (Quarto markdown) files - Applies the theme and styling from _quarto.yml - Generates the blog listing page - Creates navigation structure - Outputs a complete static website in _site/

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Project Configuration
The heart of the website is the _quarto.yml configuration file, which defines:

Project type: Website
Navigation structure: Home and Blog pages
Theme: Cosmo (a clean, professional Bootstrap theme)
Social links: GitHub and LinkedIn
Output directory: _site/

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Adding New Blog Posts
Creating a new blog post is straightforward:

Create a new directory under posts/ with a descriptive name
Add an index.qmd file with YAML frontmatter
Write the content in markdown
Push to GitHub - the site automatically rebuilds!

Example frontmatter:
---
title: "Your Post Title"
description: "Brief description"
author: "Your Name"
date: "2026-02-17"
categories: [category1, category2]
---

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Features I Love

Clean URLs
Each blog post gets a clean URL structure: yoursite.com/posts/post-name/


Automatic Listings
The blog listing page automatically updates with new posts, sorted by date, with categories and descriptions.


Responsive Design
The site looks great on mobile, tablet, and desktop without any extra work.


Fast and Lightweight
As a static site, it loads incredibly quickly and requires no server-side processing.

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Future Improvements
Here are some enhancements I‚Äôm considering:

Adding a search functionality
Including code execution for interactive examples
Adding images and visualizations to posts
Creating a projects showcase page
Adding RSS feed for blog subscribers
Implementing comments system (possibly via GitHub discussions)

title: Building This Website with Quarto
section: Getting Started with Your Own Site
text:
Getting Started with Your Own Site
If you‚Äôre interested in creating a similar website, here are the basic steps:

Install Quarto from quarto.org
Create a _quarto.yml configuration file
Write your content in .qmd files
Preview locally with quarto preview
Set up GitHub Actions for deployment
Configure GitHub Pages in your repository settings

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Resources

Quarto Documentation
Quarto Gallery - Inspiration from other sites
GitHub Actions for Quarto

title: Building This Website with Quarto
text:
Conclusion
Building this website with Quarto has been a rewarding experience. The combination of simplicity, power, and automation makes it an excellent choice for academic and technical professionals who want to maintain a professional web presence without getting bogged down in web development complexities.
I‚Äôm excited to use this platform to share my research journey, tutorials, and insights. Stay tuned for more posts about bioinformatics, genomics, and computational biology!

Have questions about setting up your own Quarto website? Feel free to reach out via email or connect with me on LinkedIn!

title: Dal Recipe
text:
I wanted to try writing about what I had for lunch today.
Dal is a North Indian/South Asian dish that is made from red/yellow lentils.

title: Dal Recipe
text:
I wanted to try writing about what I had for lunch today.
Dal is a North Indian/South Asian dish that is made from red/yellow lentils.

title: Dal Recipe
text:
Recipe
Ingredients:

1 red onion, chopped
1 tomato, chopped
1 tbsp Ginger-garlic paste
3-4 Indian/Thai green chilies, slit
2 dried red chili
1 tsp Cumin seeds
1 cup toor dal/masoor dal (available at your local South Asian store/Walmart)
3-4 tbsp cooking oil

Steps:

First cook the 1 cup dal. I like to use a pressure cooker to do so (4 whistles; 1:2 - dal:water), but you can also boil it for about 30 mins or until it becomes soft and mushy.
Mash the dal and keep it aside.
Next, to a pan, add oil and let it warm up.
Add cummin seeds, dried red chili and slit green chilies and wait for 2-3 minutes.
Now, add the chopped red onion and ginger-garlic paste. Sautee it till it turns transparent.
Add the tomatoes and stir until it‚Äôs cooked, which should take no more than 6-7 mins.
Add the mashed dal and stir.
Add salt to taste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1sp coriander powder, 1 tsp garam masala and a pinch of turmeric.
Mix everything well.
Add some water and let it simmer.
Fix the spices to taste and let it cool.
Add some ghee on top (optional) and enjoy!

title: Suraksha Vinod
text:
üìç State College, PA

Email | LinkedIn | GitHub



Doctor of Philosophy ‚Äì Bioinformatics and Genomics
The Pennsylvania State University, State College, PA
Aug 2025 ‚Äì Present
Master of Science ‚Äì Bioinformatics
Georgia Institute of Technology, Atlanta, GA
Aug 2023 ‚Äì May 2025
Bachelor of Technology ‚Äì Biotechnology
PES University, India
Aug 2019 ‚Äì May 2023




Graduate Research Assistant - Georgia Institute of Technology
Jan ‚Äô24 - Dec ‚Äô24
Atlanta, GA - Developed a computational pipeline to investigate the influence of ancestry and environment on polygenic scores across five diseases in a diverse WGS cohort of ~10,000 individuals - Integrated DNA methylation data to explore the impact of weathering on the disease risk profiles
Summer Intern - M.D.¬†Anderson Cancer Center
Jun ‚Äô24 - Aug ‚Äô24
Houston, TX - Implemented machine learning models with over 35,000 features to predict the tumor-specific total mRNA expression (TmS) across the two lung cancer types. - Performed survival analysis on TCGA datasets to examine time-to-event data, successfully identifying the significant factors influencing patient outcomes, which informed clinical decision-making. - Conducted Gene Set Enrichment Analysis (GSEA) with over 30,000 genes to validate the results, identifying the significantly over-expressed genes and pathways associated with cancer, contributing to the understanding of disease mechanisms.
Project Intern - Indian Institute of Science
Jan ‚Äô23 - Jun ‚Äô23
Bengaluru, India - Spearheaded rare variant-specific genome wide association studies (GWAS) utilizing WGS data in a cohort of over 2000 individuals. - Developed and optimized an extensive parallelized computational pipeline to detect disease associations with rare variants and identify causal variants, and interpretation of the GWAS results using statistical plots. - Developed an automated computational pipeline to run quality control measures and downstream genomic data analyses.
Research Intern - Leucine Rich Bio Pvt Ptd
Jun ‚Äô22 - Dec ‚Äô22
Bengaluru, India - Curated and managed a comprehensive database highlighting key insights on the gut microbiome and its association with neurodegenerative diseases, specifically Parkinson‚Äôs disease (PD), facilitating data interpretation. - Explored the implications of gut microbiome on PD through Bioinformatics data analysis on Galaxy.





Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease classifier from fMRI data | GitHub
Leveraged machine learning approaches to accurately classify and predict Alzheimer‚Äôs Disease patients, Mild Cognitive Impairment patients, and Healthy Controls using 60 fMRI scans from the ADNI database, achieving a prediction accuracy of 78%.
CityScout - Identifying Safe Cities Based on Crime Statistics | GitHub
Lauched a web-based tool to identify safe U.S. cities for various use cases (e.g., girls‚Äô trips, family relocation, vacation with children, etc.) and customizable filters tailored to specific demographics (e.g., resident, gender, children, etc.) by analyzing 2TB of FBI crime data using PySpark on Google Cloud Platform and Tableau for data visualization.
Comparison of ML models to predict absorption properties | GitHub
Applied and compared four machine learning models to predict human plasma protein binding rate (PPBR), bioavailability (BIO) and parallel artificial membrane permeability assay (PAMPA) aiming to contribute to the advancement of predictive modeling in drug discovery. Utilized at least 11 features per property and the PyTDC data to build models, achieving a model accuracy of 71%.
